sentences.en: A Navy medic was wounded by sniper fire.
sentences.cn: 一名海军卫生员被狙击手射伤了。

sentences.en: Banks spent his national service in the Royal Navy.
sentences.cn: 班克斯在皇家海军服过兵役。

sentences.en: Dickie bored him all through the meal with stories of the Navy.
sentences.cn: 迪基吃饭时一直在讲海军的故事，让他不胜其烦。

sentences.en: He is home on leave from the Navy.
sentences.cn: 他从海军部队休假回到家里。

sentences.en: He joined the navy during the war.
sentences.cn: 他在战争期间参加了海军。

sentences.en: He served during peace-time as an intelligence officer in the Navy.
sentences.cn: 他在和平时期担任海军情报官员。

sentences.en: He wasn't drafted for the war; he volunteered for the Navy.
sentences.cn: 他不是因为这次战争才被征召入伍的，他是自愿加入海军的。

sentences.en: He wore his cleanest slacks, a clean shirt and a navy blazer.
sentences.cn: 他穿着他最干净的便裤，洁净的衬衫和藏青色上装。

sentences.en: His cousin is somebody quite high up in the navy.
sentences.cn: 他的堂兄是一位海军高官。

sentences.en: Petty officers are the backbone of a navy.
She was a knockout in navy and scarlet.
sentences.cn: 她身着藏青色和鲜红色相间的衣服，十分迷人。

sentences.en: Sophie looked chic in lime green and navy.
sentences.cn: 索菲身着酸橙绿和海军蓝，显得很时尚。

sentences.en: The British navy boarded the vessel and towed it to New York.
sentences.cn: 英国海军登上船，把它拖到纽约。

sentences.en: The navy resorted to the press-gang.
sentences.cn: 海军不得不让征兵队强制征兵。

sentences.en: The Royal Navy would command the seas.
sentences.cn: 皇家海军会控制所有海域。

sentences.en: There was very little snobbery or class-consciousness in the wartime navy.
sentences.cn: 战时的海军中很少有势利眼，阶级意识也不强。

phrases.tran_cn: n. 海军工厂；海军船坞

trans.tran_en: the part of a country’s military forces that fights at sea
